snippet: The number 1,144 — the delegates required to clinch the Republican presidential nomination — has become an all-consuming obsession in the campaign.
abstract: Political Memo; Republican primary contest, heretofore dominated by criticisms of Pres Obama, has shifted to focus on attaining delegates, namely the 1,114 required to clinch the nomination; phenomenon offers a rare example of back-room calculations becoming a national conversation; delegate-focus is especially strong in the case of Mitt Romney, who speaks openly about it at campaign events.
lead_paragraph: The number 1,144 — the delegates required to clinch the Republican presidential nomination — has become an all-consuming obsession in the campaign.

headline.seo: Republican Presidential Race Shifts Focus to Delegates
headline.main: A Shift in Focus, From Obama to Numbers
headline.print_headline: A Shift in Focus, From Obama to Numbers
